title: Ripple’s Billion Dollar New Deal Allegedly Has Big Hidden Significance – Here Are The Potential Implications
body: Dominic Kwok, co-founder of Web3 education platform EasyA, described Ripple’s recent acquisition of prime brokerage firm Hidden Road as one of the most significant deals in crypto history. Speaking from Paris Blockchain Week, where the news first broke, Kwok noted that the deal holds transformative potential for Ripple, XRP Ledger, and the broader digital asset ecosystem. “I’ve followed tons of deals in the crypto space, but Ripple’s acquisition of Hidden Road is undoubtedly one of the most significant,” Kwok said on X. “This makes Ripple the first crypto company to own and operate a global, multi-asset prime broker.” The acquisition, reportedly valued at $1.25 billion, allows Ripple to offer full-service trading and clearing solutions that rival those of Wall Street’s most prominent financial institutions, according to Kwok. Hidden Road, which processes over $3 trillion in transactions annually and serves over 300 institutional clients, will now become a central pillar of Ripple’s efforts to bring institutional-grade services to the crypto world. Related News: Binance CEO Talks About Recent Events: How Will Tariffs Affect Cryptocurrencies? “Hidden Road processes over $10 billion in transactions on any given day and over 50 million transactions on traditional finance rails. Now, this will run on the XRP Ledger,” he added. According to Kwok, one of the key benefits of the acquisition is that Hidden Road’s operations will be deeply integrated into Ripple’s ecosystem. All transactions made through Hidden Road will be moved to the XRP Ledger, while Ripple’s native stablecoin, RLUSD, will be used as collateral for the firm’s brokerage services. According to Kwok, this is expected to significantly increase real-world institutional adoption of both XRP Ledger and RLUSD, solidifying Ripple’s position as a leading infrastructure provider in the digital finance space. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Ripple’s Billion Dollar New Deal Allegedly Has Big Hidden Significance – Here Are The Potential Implications

title: Ukraine Sets 18% Income Tax on Virtual Assets
body: Ukraine has taken a big step toward formalizing its approach to taxing cryptocurrencies, with the National Securities and Stock Market Commission (NSSMC) releasing a detailed taxation matrix for virtual assets. The proposal outlines both standard and preferential tax models, signalling a move to align the country’s financial system with global digital asset norms. Shared publicly on Telegram by Commission head Ruslan Magomedov on Tuesday, the proposal suggests a personal income tax rate of 18% and an additional 5% military levy on virtual asset gains. Introduced during wartime, the military levy functions as an additional tax to help fund the country’s defense efforts. Alternatively, the model includes preferential tax rates of 5% and 9% for certain categories. These recommendations draw on international examples and are tailored to fit within Ukraine’s legal framework. “In the digital age, taxation of cryptocurrencies is no longer a hypothesis – it’s a rapidly approaching reality,” Magomedov said. “That’s why the NSSMC has developed a matrix presenting various taxation options for virtual asset transactions – from mining to airdrops.” Ukraine is considering a 5-10% tax on crypto income, with legislation expected by mid-2025. The move looks to bolster state revenue while navigating regulatory hurdles. #CryptoRegulations #CryptoTax #Ukraine https://t.co/MbtXiYCWi3 — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) February 28, 2025 Ukraine Looks Abroad for Guidance as It Builds Its Crypto Tax Framework The proposed rules define taxable income either as gross revenue or net income after expenses. Income would generally be recognized when received or when assets are exchanged for fiat currency or non-virtual goods and services. Transactions that involve only virtual assets would not trigger a tax under this model. The matrix references countries with more favorable treatment of crypto activity. Austria and France, for example, do not tax crypto-to-crypto exchanges. Singapore does not levy capital gains taxes on individuals or companies. Malaysia exempts transactions unless they are routine or business-related. Georgia offers full exemptions for individuals on income and capital gains from digital assets. Reports in February indicated that Ukrainian authorities were working on legislation to introduce a 5%-10% tax on crypto by mid-2025, aiming to boost state revenue and support military funding amid the ongoing war with Russia. Ukraine Clarifies VAT Treatment for Crypto Operations Like Mining and Staking The document also provides tax guidance on mining, staking, airdrops and hard forks. Activities like free token supply, token creation, and storing virtual assets would not be subject to VAT. However, rewards or services that involve token modification or crypto payments for goods and services may be taxed. Some of these transactions may qualify for exemptions under Article 135 of the EU VAT Directive. This applies especially if they are considered payment-related services. The Commission noted that this classification may need additional interpretation and legal guidance. Ukraine’s effort to establish a clear tax policy for virtual assets comes at a time of economic strain and heightened interest in digital finance. The Commission has already introduced the matrix to lawmakers and now plans to engage directly with market participants as part of its regulatory development process. The post Ukraine Sets 18% Income Tax on Virtual Assets appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: While Ripple Claims XRP Case Is Settled and Dropped, SEC Says It Is Not Over
body: Ripple’s years-long courtroom saga with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) may be approaching its conclusion, but confusion still looms over the case’s final status. In a bold statement, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse recently suggested that the dispute has been resolved. Echoing his sentiment, Ripple’s Chief Legal Officer revealed that both parties have opted to drop their respective appeals — Ripple will no longer pursue its cross-appeal. The SEC has allegedly withdrawn its challenge. As part of this supposed agreement, Ripple has agreed to pay a $50 million fine — a much lower figure than the $125 million penalty initially on the table. However, despite Ripple’s optimism, the SEC has not yet confirmed the reported resolution . This silence has only deepened speculation and raised concerns about whether the case is truly over. SEC Disputes Ripple’s Settlement Claims The uncertainty intensified when the SEC recently filed a motion opposing an “ emergency request” submitted by Justin W. Keener — an independent party claiming to possess critical evidence that could benefit Ripple. Keener’s filing aimed to introduce this evidence before the court, but the SEC pushed back, urging Judge Analisa Torres to reject the motion outright. Among its arguments, the SEC contended that the district court no longer has jurisdiction, pointing out that the case has moved to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals. Furthermore, the agency argued that Keener lacked the legal standing to involve himself in the proceedings and that, as the defendant, Ripple has the discretion to decide whether such evidence is in its favor. Legal Analyst Flags Inconsistencies Attorney Bill Morgan highlighted a discrepancy in the SEC’s filing. While Ripple announced a concluded settlement, the SEC’s statement to Judge Torres claims the appeal process is ongoing, directly contradicting Ripple’s public assertion. This inconsistency raises questions about the case’s status and potential implications for XRP, settlement negotiations, the appeal process, and XRP’s price movement. Such an odd thing that Ripple say the Appeal and Cross-Appeal is settled but the SEC writes to Judge Torres that the matter is still on appeal. Settled but not quite over. https://t.co/TpNv2DcKoE pic.twitter.com/XFAKJAzUUP — bill morgan (@Belisarius2020) April 9, 2025 This discrepancy has further fueled uncertainty, prompting legal observers, XRP investors, and the broader crypto community to question who is telling the complete story. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Community Calls for Clarity Currently, the status of the SEC v. Ripple case remains murky. On the one hand, Ripple has declared the chapter closed, citing the mutual withdrawal of appeals and a reduced fine. On the other hand, the SEC’s recent actions and court statements suggest that litigation — or at least procedural matters — are still active. Now, market participants and stakeholders are demanding transparency. There is increasing demand for the SEC to issue a formal statement clarifying whether the case has reached a definitive conclusion or if the legal wrangling will continue. Until then, the case that has defined crypto regulation in the U.S. for years remains stuck in limbo, despite the supposed light at the end of the tunnel. title: Critical Bitcoin Support Level: Chris Burniske Pinpoints Strategic $70K Zone
body: Is the crypto market bracing for another dip? Amidst the ever-dynamic world of digital currencies, seasoned crypto analyst Chris Burniske, formerly a lead at ARK Invest and now with Placeholder VC, has offered a crucial insight for Bitcoin (BTC) investors. His recent analysis suggests a potentially strategic support level for Bitcoin at $70,000, should it retrace from its current position. Let’s delve into what this means for your crypto portfolio and the broader market sentiment. Understanding the Bitcoin Support Level: Burniske’s $70K Insight Burniske’s analysis centers around the idea that if Bitcoin were to fall below $76,000 again, the next significant Bitcoin support level to watch out for is $70,000. But why $70,000? According to Burniske, this level isn’t arbitrary; it’s rooted in Bitcoin’s recent price history and market behavior. Here’s a breakdown: 2021 Bull Market Peak Echo: The $70,000 mark is closely aligned with the peak of the 2021 bull market. Historical peaks often transform into support levels during subsequent market cycles. 2024 Consolidation Range Upper Limit: Between March and October 2024, Bitcoin largely traded within a consolidation range. $70,000 represented the upper boundary of this range. Breaking out of a consolidation range and then retesting its upper limit as support is a common pattern in technical analysis. Strong Support Zone: The confluence of these two factors – the 2021 peak and the 2024 consolidation range – creates a robust support zone around $70,000. This means there’s a higher probability of buyers stepping in at this level to prevent further price declines. While a dip to $70,000 might initially trigger concerns and fuel crypto market analysis suggesting a deeper correction, Burniske presents a different perspective – one of opportunity. He suggests that such a scenario could be viewed as a strategic accumulation phase for savvy investors. Why $70K Could Be a Strategic Accumulation Zone? The idea of “strategic accumulation” might sound counterintuitive when prices are potentially falling. However, in the world of crypto, periods of price retracement can often present opportune moments to build your portfolio. Here’s why Burniske might see a dip to $70,000 as a strategic accumulation opportunity: Buying the Dip Mentality: Experienced crypto investors often look for chances to “buy the dip.” A drop to a well-defined support level like $70,000 can signal a potential bottom or at least a temporary price floor. Long-Term Perspective: Burniske, known for his long-term vision on crypto, likely views short-term price fluctuations as noise in the grander scheme of Bitcoin’s adoption and growth trajectory. Accumulating at support levels aligns with a long-term investment strategy. Reduced Risk at Support: Buying at a recognized support level can potentially reduce risk compared to buying during price rallies. If the support holds, the downside risk is limited. Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): A dip to $70,000 could be an ideal point to implement or continue a dollar-cost averaging strategy, gradually building your Bitcoin holdings over time. However, it’s crucial to remember that BTC price prediction and market analysis are not guarantees. While $70,000 represents a strong support level, there’s always a possibility that Bitcoin could fall further. Therefore, any investment decision should be made with careful consideration and risk management. Chris Burniske: A Voice of Experience in Crypto When figures like Chris Burniske offer market insights, it’s worth paying attention. His background lends significant credibility to his analysis: Former ARK Invest Crypto Lead: ARK Invest, under Cathie Wood, is renowned for its bullish stance on disruptive technologies, including cryptocurrencies. Burniske’s tenure as their crypto lead provided him with deep insights into the market. Placeholder VC Managing Partner: Placeholder VC is a venture capital firm specifically focused on blockchain technologies. This ongoing involvement in the crypto space keeps Burniske at the forefront of industry developments and market trends. Long-Term Crypto Advocate: Burniske is known for his long-term, fundamental-driven approach to crypto investing, contrasting with short-term trading mentalities. His analysis isn’t just about short-term price movements; it often incorporates a broader understanding of market cycles, technological adoption, and macroeconomic factors influencing the crypto space. Navigating Bitcoin Volatility: Key Takeaways The cryptocurrency market, and Bitcoin in particular, is known for its volatility. Burniske’s analysis provides a framework for understanding and potentially navigating these fluctuations. Here are some key takeaways: Identify Key Support Levels: Understanding support and resistance levels is fundamental to technical analysis and can help in making informed investment decisions. Strategic Thinking Over Panic Selling: Instead of reacting emotionally to price dips, consider whether they present strategic opportunities for accumulation, especially at identified support levels. Long-Term Perspective is Crucial: Crypto investing is often a long-term game. Short-term volatility should be viewed within the context of long-term growth potential. Risk Management is Paramount: Never invest more than you can afford to lose, and always diversify your portfolio to manage risk effectively. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of market analysis from credible sources like Chris Burniske and conduct your own research before making investment decisions. Conclusion: Strategic Opportunities Amidst Market Fluctuations Chris Burniske’s suggestion of $70,000 as a key Bitcoin support level offers valuable perspective for crypto investors. While market dips can be unsettling, they can also unveil strategic opportunities for those with a long-term vision and a sound understanding of market dynamics. By identifying critical support zones and adopting a strategic approach to accumulation, investors can potentially navigate the inherent volatility of the crypto market more effectively. As always, informed decision-making and prudent risk management remain the cornerstones of successful crypto investing. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Shocking Data: Bitcoin Dominance Over Ethereum in Crypto Trading – A Deep Dive
body: For years, the cryptocurrency world has been captivated by the dynamic duo of Bitcoin and Ethereum. Often seen as the digital gold and silver, respectively, these two giants command the lion’s share of market attention and investment. But beneath the surface of daily price fluctuations and exciting project launches, a fascinating trend has emerged: Bitcoin’s persistent outperformance against Ethereum on the majority of trading days. Is this a temporary blip or a long-term reality? Let’s dive into the data and uncover the intriguing story behind the Bitcoin dominance narrative. Decoding the Bitcoin vs. Ethereum Performance Puzzle Recent analysis from Cointelegraph, citing analyst James Check, reveals a surprising statistic: since Ethereum’s inception in mid-2015, Bitcoin (BTC) has outperformed Ethereum (ETH) on a staggering 85% of all trading days. This isn’t just a marginal lead; it’s a consistent trend that challenges the narrative of Ethereum as the ultimate ‘crypto 2.0’ poised to overtake Bitcoin. But how can we interpret this data, and what does it mean for investors? Historical Context: When Did Ethereum Shine? It’s not all Bitcoin’s game, all the time. The data highlights specific periods where Ethereum did indeed take the lead. These golden windows for ETH primarily occurred: Mid-2015 to Mid-2017: This era marked the early excitement around Ethereum and its smart contract capabilities. The potential of decentralized applications (dApps) and Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) fueled significant interest and investment in ETH, allowing it to outpace Bitcoin for a considerable stretch. Late 2019 and Early 2020: Brief bursts of stronger Ethereum performance also punctuated the market in late 2019 and early 2020. These periods might be attributed to specific Ethereum network upgrades, DeFi hype starting to build, or shifts in broader market sentiment. However, these periods of Ethereum outperformance have been relatively short-lived compared to Bitcoin’s consistent lead over the long term. This brings us to the crucial metric: the ETH/BTC ratio. The ETH/BTC Ratio: A Five-Year Low The ETH/BTC ratio is a key indicator for understanding the relative strength of Ethereum against Bitcoin. It essentially tells you how much Ethereum is worth in Bitcoin terms. A rising ratio suggests Ethereum is gaining value faster than Bitcoin, and a falling ratio indicates Bitcoin is outperforming. As of April 9th, according to TradingView data, this ratio plummeted to a five-year low of 0.018. This chart visually represents the trend. The declining ETH/BTC ratio underscores the sustained period of Bitcoin’s relative strength. But what factors are driving this trend? Analyzing Cryptocurrency Performance Drivers Several factors can influence the relative cryptocurrency performance of Bitcoin and Ethereum. Let’s consider some key elements: Bitcoin’s ‘Store of Value’ Narrative: Bitcoin has solidified its position as digital gold, attracting investors seeking a hedge against inflation and economic uncertainty. In times of market volatility or economic downturns, investors often flock to Bitcoin as a perceived safer haven within the crypto space. Ethereum’s Utility and Complexity: Ethereum’s strength lies in its utility – powering dApps, DeFi, NFTs, and more. However, this complexity also introduces challenges. Network congestion, high gas fees, and the ongoing transition to Ethereum 2.0 can create headwinds for ETH’s price performance. Market Cycles and Sentiment: The broader crypto market trends significantly impact both Bitcoin and Ethereum. During bull markets, both tend to rise, but the magnitude of gains can vary. In bear markets, both typically decline, but the rate of decline and investor sentiment can differ. Technological Developments and Upgrades: Major upgrades or technological advancements in either Bitcoin or Ethereum ecosystems can trigger shifts in investor sentiment and relative performance. For example, Bitcoin’s Taproot upgrade and Ethereum’s ongoing transition to Proof-of-Stake are significant events that can influence market dynamics. Institutional Adoption: Institutional investment flows into Bitcoin have generally been more robust and consistent compared to Ethereum. This institutional demand further strengthens Bitcoin’s position as a leading cryptocurrency. What Does This Mean for Crypto Investors? Understanding the historical performance and the ETH/BTC ratio provides valuable insights for crypto investors. Here are some actionable takeaways: Diversification Remains Key: While Bitcoin has shown consistent outperformance, diversification across different cryptocurrencies, including both BTC and ETH, is still a prudent strategy. Different market cycles may favor different assets. Monitor the ETH/BTC Ratio: Keep an eye on the ETH/BTC ratio as a gauge of relative strength. A sustained reversal in the downward trend could signal a potential shift in market dynamics favoring Ethereum. Stay Informed on Developments: Track technological upgrades, adoption metrics, and regulatory changes impacting both Bitcoin and Ethereum. These factors can significantly influence their future performance. Consider Risk Tolerance: Bitcoin, with its established store of value narrative, might be considered a relatively less risky crypto asset compared to Ethereum, which, while offering immense potential, also faces ongoing development and scaling challenges. Align your investment strategy with your risk appetite. The Future Landscape: Will Ethereum Catch Up? The cryptocurrency landscape is constantly evolving. While historical data points to Bitcoin’s dominance in outperforming Ethereum on most trading days, the future is not set in stone. Ethereum’s transition to ETH 2.0, with its promise of improved scalability and lower fees, could potentially be a game-changer. The growth of the DeFi and NFT sectors, largely built on Ethereum, also presents significant opportunities for ETH to regain momentum. However, Bitcoin’s first-mover advantage, strong network effects, and established institutional adoption are formidable strengths. The competition between these two crypto titans will undoubtedly continue to shape the market for years to come. Conclusion: Navigating the Bitcoin and Ethereum Dynamic The data is clear: Bitcoin has historically outperformed Ethereum on the vast majority of trading days since ETH’s launch. The ETH/BTC ratio’s five-year low further underscores this trend. While Ethereum has had its moments of glory, Bitcoin’s resilience and ‘digital gold’ narrative have generally prevailed. For crypto investors, understanding this dynamic is crucial for informed decision-making. Diversification, monitoring key metrics like the ETH/BTC ratio, and staying abreast of technological and market developments are essential strategies for navigating the ever-changing world of cryptocurrencies. The shocking consistency of Bitcoin’s outperformance serves as a powerful reminder of the nuanced and often unpredictable nature of the crypto market. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum price action.

title: Paycoin Revolutionizes Pizza Payments at Pizza Hut Korea with Crypto!
body: Are you craving a slice of your favorite Pizza Hut pizza in South Korea? And are you also a crypto enthusiast eager to use your digital assets for everyday purchases? Well, get ready for some fantastic news! Paycoin (PCI), the innovative virtual asset payment platform, has just announced a game-changing update that will make your pizza cravings even more satisfying. Now, you can pay for your Pizza Hut orders in South Korea using crypto payments ! What’s the Buzz About Crypto Payments at Pizza Hut Korea? In a recent announcement that sent ripples of excitement through the crypto community, Paycoin (PCI) officially declared its support for crypto payments at Pizza Hut branches across South Korea. This means you can now use Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and of course, Paycoin (PCI) itself to settle your bills at your favorite pizza place. This move is a significant step forward in mainstream cryptocurrency adoption and showcases the growing acceptance of digital currencies in everyday transactions. Let’s break down what this exciting development means for you: Seamless Crypto Transactions: No more hassle of converting your crypto to fiat currency before indulging in a cheesy pizza. Pay directly with your Bitcoin, Ethereum, or PCI through the Paycoin app. Expanded Payment Options: Pizza Hut Korea now welcomes a wider range of payment methods, catering to the tech-savvy and crypto-inclined customers. Real-World Utility for Crypto: This isn’t just about holding crypto; it’s about using it in real-world scenarios, demonstrating the practical application of digital currencies in daily life. Boost for Cryptocurrency Adoption in South Korea: Pizza Hut is a major brand, and its acceptance of crypto payments through Paycoin signals a significant leap in mainstream acceptance of cryptocurrencies within South Korea. Paycoin Leading the Charge in South Korea’s Crypto Payment Scene Paycoin has been at the forefront of bridging the gap between the digital asset world and everyday commerce. As a virtual asset payment platform, it has consistently sought to expand the utility of cryptocurrencies by partnering with major brands and retailers. Their recent announcement about Pizza Hut Korea is a testament to their commitment to making crypto payments accessible and convenient for everyone. Prior to this Pizza Hut integration, Paycoin had already established a strong presence in South Korea’s payment ecosystem. They have been actively expanding their ‘Wallet Pay’ support to include a diverse range of major brand-affiliated stores. This proactive approach has positioned Paycoin as a key player in driving cryptocurrency adoption within the South Korean market. Key features of Paycoin platform: Feature Description Wallet Pay Enables users to pay with cryptocurrencies at partnered merchants using the Paycoin app. Supported Cryptocurrencies Initially focused on PCI, now expanding to include major cryptocurrencies like BTC and ETH. Merchant Network Growing network of partnered stores, now including Pizza Hut Korea, alongside other major brands. User-Friendly App Intuitive mobile application for managing crypto assets and making payments. Pizza Hut Korea Embraces Bitcoin Payments and Ethereum Payments Why is Pizza Hut Korea’s decision to accept Bitcoin payments and Ethereum payments so significant? It’s all about mainstream appeal and market reach. Pizza Hut is a globally recognized and beloved brand, particularly popular in South Korea. By embracing cryptocurrency payments, they are signaling to a vast consumer base that digital currencies are becoming a legitimate and practical form of payment. This move by Pizza Hut Korea can be seen as a strategic decision to: Attract a New Customer Segment: Tap into the growing demographic of crypto users and tech-savvy consumers who prefer digital payment methods. Enhance Brand Image: Position themselves as an innovative and forward-thinking brand that embraces technological advancements. Stay Competitive: In an increasingly digital world, offering diverse payment options is crucial for staying competitive and meeting evolving consumer demands. Potentially Reduce Transaction Fees: Cryptocurrency transactions can sometimes offer lower fees compared to traditional payment methods, although this can vary. The inclusion of both Bitcoin payments and Ethereum payments alongside Paycoin (PCI) demonstrates a commitment to providing customers with flexibility and choice in their crypto payment options. It acknowledges the diverse crypto holdings of consumers and aims to cater to a broader audience. Benefits of Using Paycoin for Crypto Payments at Pizza Hut So, why should you consider using Paycoin for your next Pizza Hut order? Let’s explore the benefits: Convenience: Pay directly from your Paycoin wallet app – quick, easy, and hassle-free. Utilize Your Crypto Holdings: Put your Bitcoin, Ethereum, and PCI to practical use beyond just holding or trading. Potential Rewards and Incentives: Paycoin often offers promotions and rewards for using their platform, potentially giving you added value when you pay with crypto. Check the Paycoin app for current offers! Secure Transactions: Cryptocurrency transactions are known for their security, offering a safe and reliable way to pay. Be Part of the Crypto Revolution: By using crypto for everyday purchases, you are actively contributing to the growth and mainstream adoption of digital currencies. For crypto enthusiasts in South Korea, this partnership between Paycoin and Pizza Hut is a dream come true. It’s no longer just about discussing the potential of crypto; it’s about experiencing its real-world utility, one delicious pizza slice at a time. Challenges and Future of Crypto Payments in South Korea While this news is incredibly positive, it’s important to acknowledge the broader landscape of cryptocurrency adoption in South Korea and the challenges that still exist. Challenges: Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies is constantly evolving in South Korea and globally. Clear and consistent regulations are crucial for sustained growth. Price Volatility: Cryptocurrency prices can be volatile, which might be a concern for both merchants and consumers. However, platforms like Paycoin often have mechanisms to mitigate this risk at the point of sale. Public Perception and Education: Continued education and awareness campaigns are needed to improve public understanding and trust in cryptocurrencies. Scalability and Transaction Speed: While Bitcoin and Ethereum have made strides, scalability and transaction speed remain areas of ongoing development for wider mainstream adoption. Future Outlook: Despite these challenges, the future of crypto payments in South Korea looks promising. The partnership between Paycoin and Pizza Hut is a strong indicator of growing mainstream acceptance. As more businesses and consumers embrace digital currencies, we can expect to see: Increased Merchant Adoption: More retailers and service providers will likely start accepting cryptocurrencies as payment. Innovation in Payment Solutions: Platforms like Paycoin will continue to innovate and develop user-friendly solutions for crypto payments. Greater Regulatory Clarity: Governments worldwide are working towards establishing clearer regulatory frameworks for cryptocurrencies, which will foster growth and stability. Wider Consumer Adoption: As awareness and ease of use improve, more consumers will become comfortable using cryptocurrencies for everyday transactions. Conclusion: A Taste of the Future with Crypto and Pizza Paycoin’s integration of crypto payments at Pizza Hut Korea is more than just a minor update; it’s a significant milestone in the journey towards mainstream cryptocurrency adoption. It’s a powerful example of how digital assets are moving beyond investment and speculation into practical, everyday use cases. Imagine a world where you can pay for groceries, coffee, and even your favorite pizza with Bitcoin, Ethereum, or your preferred cryptocurrency. Thanks to initiatives like Paycoin’s partnership with Pizza Hut, that future is rapidly becoming a reality, especially in forward-thinking markets like South Korea. So, next time you’re in South Korea and craving pizza, remember you can now indulge with crypto! It’s a delicious taste of the future, served hot and fresh. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption.

title: Decoding the Impactful U.S. Reciprocal Tariff Policy: A Crypto Investor’s Guide
body: In an era where global economics and digital assets are increasingly intertwined, understanding shifts in international trade policies becomes crucial for cryptocurrency enthusiasts and investors. The recent implementation of the U.S. reciprocal tariff policy , as reported by CNBC, marks a significant development in the global economic landscape. But what does this policy truly entail, and how might it ripple through the world of crypto? Let’s decode this impactful policy and explore its potential implications. Understanding the U.S. Reciprocal Tariff Policy The term “ reciprocal tariff policy ” might sound complex, but at its core, it’s about fairness and balance in international trade. Essentially, it allows the United States to impose tariffs on goods from a country that has already imposed tariffs on U.S. goods. It’s a tit-for-tat approach designed to encourage other nations to lower their trade barriers and create a more level playing field. Think of it as a negotiation tactic on a global scale, where tariffs become the bargaining chips. Here’s a breakdown of the key aspects: Action-Reaction Framework: The policy is fundamentally reactive. It’s triggered when another country imposes tariffs or other trade restrictions that harm U.S. exports. Aim for Fairness: The primary goal is to achieve ‘reciprocity’ – if country X charges a 10% tariff on U.S. goods, the U.S. might respond by charging a similar tariff on goods from country X. Negotiating Tool: Reciprocal tariffs are intended to be more than just punitive measures. They are designed to incentivize trading partners to negotiate and remove unfair trade practices. Economic Leverage: By wielding the power of tariffs, the U.S. aims to exert economic pressure to open up foreign markets and ensure fairer trade conditions for American businesses. Benefits of the Reciprocal Tariff Policy Proponents of the reciprocal tariff policy argue that it offers several potential benefits, both for the U.S. economy and potentially for the global trade environment in the long run. Let’s explore some of these advantages: Leveling the Playing Field: One of the most cited benefits is the creation of a fairer trade environment. When countries face reciprocal tariffs, they may be more inclined to reduce their own tariffs, leading to a more balanced global market. Protecting Domestic Industries: Reciprocal tariffs can act as a shield for domestic industries that are unfairly targeted by foreign tariffs. This protection can help maintain jobs and encourage local production. Boosting U.S. Exports: By pushing trading partners to lower their tariffs, the policy could ultimately lead to increased U.S. exports as American goods become more competitive in foreign markets. Strengthening Negotiating Position: The threat of reciprocal tariffs enhances the U.S.’s negotiating power in trade discussions. It provides leverage to push for more favorable trade agreements. Potential for Reduced Global Tariffs: In the ideal scenario, the policy could trigger a domino effect, where countries progressively lower tariffs to avoid reciprocal actions, ultimately leading to lower global tariffs overall. Challenges and Potential Drawbacks While the reciprocal tariff policy aims for positive outcomes, it’s not without its challenges and potential downsides. It’s crucial to consider these aspects to have a balanced perspective: Risk of Trade Wars: The most significant risk is escalation. Reciprocal tariffs can easily spiral into trade wars, where countries continuously retaliate with higher and higher tariffs, harming global trade and economic growth. Impact on Consumers: Tariffs are essentially taxes on imported goods. These costs can be passed on to consumers in the form of higher prices for everyday products, potentially leading to inflation. Disruptions to Supply Chains: Tariffs can disrupt established global supply chains, forcing businesses to find new sources or adjust production, which can be costly and inefficient. Negative Impact on Certain Industries: While some domestic industries might benefit, others that rely on imported components or export to countries facing reciprocal tariffs could be negatively impacted. Global Economic Uncertainty: Increased trade tensions and tariff disputes can create uncertainty in the global economy, making businesses hesitant to invest and potentially slowing down economic growth. Examples of Reciprocal Tariff Policy in Action To better understand how the reciprocal tariff policy works in practice, let’s consider some hypothetical examples: Example 1: Agricultural Goods Imagine Country A imposes a 20% tariff on U.S. agricultural products. In response, under the reciprocal tariff policy, the U.S. could impose a 20% tariff on agricultural goods imported from Country A. This action is designed to pressure Country A to reconsider its tariff on U.S. agricultural exports. Example 2: Technology Sector Suppose Country B implements regulations that unfairly discriminate against U.S. technology companies. The U.S. could retaliate by imposing tariffs on specific technology products imported from Country B, aiming to address the discriminatory practices and protect its tech industry. Example 3: Automotive Industry If Country C imposes high tariffs on imported automobiles, making it difficult for U.S. car manufacturers to compete, the U.S. could respond with reciprocal tariffs on automobiles or auto parts from Country C. This aims to encourage fairer access to Country C’s automotive market. Actionable Insights for Crypto Investors Now, how does all of this relate to the cryptocurrency world? While the reciprocal tariff policy is not directly targeted at crypto, it operates within the broader global economic framework that significantly influences digital assets. Here are some actionable insights for crypto investors: Monitor Global Economic News: Stay informed about developments in international trade and economic policies. Events like the implementation of reciprocal tariffs can signal shifts in global economic sentiment, which can indirectly impact crypto markets. Assess Risk Sentiment: Trade disputes and tariffs can increase economic uncertainty and risk aversion. In such environments, investors might shift away from riskier assets like cryptocurrencies, at least temporarily. Conversely, in times of economic stability fostered by fair trade, risk appetite may increase. Consider Geopolitical Impacts: Pay attention to the geopolitical implications of trade policies. Increased tensions between major economies due to tariff disputes can create market volatility, affecting both traditional and crypto assets. Diversify Investments: In times of economic uncertainty driven by trade policies, diversification becomes even more crucial. Don’t put all your eggs in one basket. Spread your investments across different asset classes, including crypto, but also consider traditional markets and asset types. Long-Term Perspective: Remember that trade policies and their impacts are often cyclical. While short-term volatility might arise from tariff implementations, long-term trends in technology and adoption are likely to be more significant drivers for the crypto market. The Broader Economic Impact and Crypto The economic impact of the U.S. reciprocal tariff policy extends beyond specific industries and countries. It contributes to the overall global economic climate. A world characterized by escalating trade tensions and tariff wars can lead to: Slower Global Growth: Reduced trade flows and increased uncertainty can dampen global economic growth, affecting all markets, including crypto. Currency Fluctuations: Trade imbalances and tariff disputes can lead to fluctuations in currency exchange rates, which can indirectly influence the value of cryptocurrencies, especially when paired against fiat currencies. Supply Chain Restructuring: Businesses may need to restructure their supply chains to mitigate tariff risks, which can have broader economic consequences and potentially impact various sectors, including those related to technology and innovation that are relevant to the crypto space. Conclusion: Navigating the New Trade Landscape The U.S. reciprocal tariff policy is a significant tool in the arsenal of trade policy, aimed at fostering fairer international trade practices. While it holds the promise of leveling the playing field and protecting domestic industries, it also carries risks of trade wars and economic disruptions. For cryptocurrency investors, understanding these broader economic shifts is paramount. By staying informed, assessing risk, and maintaining a long-term perspective, you can navigate the evolving trade landscape and make informed decisions in the dynamic world of crypto assets. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Hackers exploit SourceForge to hide crypto miners in Microsoft Office packages
body: Cybercriminals are abusing SourceForge’s project domains to spread trojanized Office installers embedded with cryptocurrency mining tools and clipboard hijackers. A newly uncovered malware campaign is turning SourceForge’s infrastructure into a launchpad for infection, leveraging the platform’s developer-friendly tools to trick users into downloading malicious crypto software. According to researchers at Kaspersky, the scheme specifically targets crypto users by disguising malware as office-related downloads — complete with bloated installers, password-protected archives, and layers of obfuscation that eventually deliver a crypto miner and a ClipBanker to hijack crypto transactions. In a blog post on Tuesday, April 8, researchers said the attackers set up a fake project on SourceForge called “officepackage,” made to look like Microsoft Office add-ins copied from GitHub. While the project page itself might look normal, the real trap was its auto-generated subdomain “officepackage.sourceforge.io,” the researchers noted. Search engines like Russia ‘s Yandex picked it up, and when users visited the page, they saw a fake list of office apps with download buttons that actually started the malware infection. Example of a malicious Microsoft Publisher package shown on Yandex’s search results page | Source: Kaspersky You might also like: Crypto users at risk as Microsoft uncovers StilachiRAT malware stealing wallet data Clicking the fake download links sends users through several redirects before delivering a small zip file. But once unzipped, it expands into a bloated 700MB installer. When launched, the installer uses hidden scripts to grab more files from GitHub, eventually unpacking malware that checks for antivirus tools before running. If no threats are detected, it installs tools like AutoIt and Netcat — one script sends system info to a Telegram bot, while another ensures the crypto-mining malware stays on the system, the researchers say. Kaspersky says 90% of affected users appear to be in Russia, with over 4,600 hits between January and March. While the campaign primarily seeks to steal crypto funds, researchers warn that infected machines may also be sold to other threat actors. Read more: Kaspersky warns of SparkCat malware that targets private keys on Android and iOS

title: Bitcoin Exchange Continues to Delists! 7 More Altcoin Trading Pairs Delisted from Spot Trading! Here Are the Details
body: Binance has announced that it will remove seven spot trading pairs from its platform on April 11, 2025, as part of its regular review process aimed at maintaining a high-quality trading environment. The exchange cited low liquidity and trading volume in its latest market review. Binance to Delisting Seven Spot Trading Pairs on April 11 According to the exchange's notification, the delisting will take place at 06:00 on April 11 and will affect trading pairs that exhibit low liquidity and trading volume. Trading Pairs to be Removed The following spot trading pairs will be delisted: ACT/BRL ALPHA/BTC BLUR/BTC CELR/BTC PENGU/BNB POND/BTC RUNE/BNB Binance clarified that these particular trading pairs will be removed, but the underlying tokens will not be deleted from the platform. Users will still be able to trade the affected assets via other existing trading pairs on Binance Spot. Impact on Trading Bots In addition, Binance will also be terminating its Spot Trading Bot services for the affected pairs at the same time as the delisting. The exchange strongly advised users to update or cancel all active trading bots associated with these pairs to avoid potential losses. Binance periodically reviews all listed trading pairs to ensure a robust and efficient market for its users. Factors that influence the decision to delist trading pairs typically include poor liquidity, low trading activity, and overall market performance. This latest move follows Binance’s broader efforts to maintain transparency and protect its user base in the increasingly competitive crypto exchange landscape. *This is not investment advice. title: Bitcoin Buy Signal Confirmed? Analysts Highlight Key Reversal Zone In Play
body: In an X post shared earlier today, crypto analyst Ali Martinez noted that Bitcoin (BTC) is flashing a buy signal. Another analyst, Titan Of Crypto, highlighted that BTC is currently trading in a reversal zone – suggesting that the leading cryptocurrency may soon experience a shift in price momentum. Bitcoin Flashes Buy Signal Amid Market Pullback Compared to the price action seen last year, Q1 2025 has been relatively sluggish for digital assets. On a year-to-date (YTD) basis, BTC is down nearly 30%, dropping from around $97,600 on January 1 to approximately $78,000 at the time of writing. Related Reading: Shifting Sentiment? Short-Term Bitcoin Holders Stay Put Despite Losses Following yesterday’s tariff-induced crypto market pullback – which wiped over $140 billion from the total crypto market cap – BTC is now beginning to show early signs of strength. Martinez emphasized that Bitcoin is flashing a weekly TD Sequential buy signal. For the uninitiated, the weekly TD Sequential buy signal is a technical indicator that suggests a potential trend reversal or buying opportunity after a prolonged downtrend. It typically appears when a specific 9-count pattern completes, signalling that selling pressure may be exhausted and a price rebound could be near. Meanwhile, fellow crypto analyst Titan Of Crypto pointed out that BTC is trading within a potential reversal zone. He noted that as long as BTC remains above the 38.2% Fibonacci retracement level, the broader uptrend would remain intact. Additionally, Titan highlighted that BTC’s Fair Value Gap (FVG) at $80,000 has now been filled – a development that further boosts the case for a potential trend reversal or significant price action at current levels. To explain, an FVG is a price imbalance on a chart, often created by a strong move in one direction, where little to no trading occurred. It indicates a potential area where price may return to “fill the gap” before continuing its trend. Recent BTC Price Drop Not Out Of The Ordinary Another crypto analyst, Master Of Crypto, remarked that although the recent BTC price decline may have alarmed some investors, it’s well within the bounds of historical norms. The analyst pointed out that BTC is currently trading about 26.6% below its all-time high (ATH) of $109,500. Related Reading: Analyst Identifies Key Bitcoin Demand Zone For ‘Substantial Gains’ – Details However, this decline is still less severe than previous market cycle drawdowns, such as 83% in 2018 and 73% in 2022. The analyst added that besides the price pullback, BTC’s weekly Relative Strength Index (RSI) has also been trending down for five weeks. That said, technical indicators suggest that it may take more time before BTC sees a meaningful shift in price momentum. For instance, the top cryptocurrency recently flashed a death cross, a bearish pattern that could signal further short-term downside. At press time, BTC trades at $78,543, down 0.3% in the past 24 hours. Featured image from Unsplash, Charts from X, and TradingView.com

title: WhiteBIT Gets Featured on Coinglass Amid Top Exchanges for Data Reliability
body: The largest crypto exchange in Europe in terms of traffic, WhiteBIT, has officially been listed on Coinglass. The latter is a premier cryptocurrency derivative data analysis platform. It’s rewarding to see Coinglass’ recognition of WhiteBIT’s determination to uphold transparency and accessibility of data that professional traders and investors need. Coinglass has established a reputation for its highly selective vetting process, and only exchanges passing its rigorous standards for trustworthiness, liquidity, and operational integrity are listed. Ranking WhiteBIT 6th in a total of only 19 exchanges speaks further to the exchange’s ability to serve as a trusted environment for trading digital assets. Volodymyr Nosov, Founder and President of WhiteBIT, comments on the listing: “Transparency and data-driven decision-making are essential for professional traders in today’s rapidly evolving crypto landscape. WhiteBIT’s recognition by Coinglass is a major milestone for us, reflecting our dedication to equipping traders with reliable and real-time market data. This inclusion further ensures our users have access to the insights they need for informed trading.” Enhanced Market Insights with WhiteBIT Derivative Data WhiteBIT’s derivative market data is now incorporated into important Coinglass sections as part of this addition, giving traders access to useful analytical tools: Home Page —featured among top exchanges for enhanced visibility; Exchanges —comparative metrics to support informed trading decisions; Open Interest —market positioning insights for derivative traders; Funding Rates —essential data for perpetual contract traders; Longs/Shorts —market sentiment indicators for trading strategies; Supercharts —advanced visualization tools for in-depth analysis. Thanks to these changes, WhiteBIT’s platform becomes a valuable support for the global crypto community by putting into their hands the information they require to take precise and strategic trading decisions, while further solidifying WhiteBIT’s image as a premier exchange platform. Security and Compliance Are of Major Importance A focus for WhiteBIT is on security, thereby it relies on an arsenal of measures to protect its systems, including cold wallets, multifactor authentication, anti-phishing facilities, and routine security audits. WhiteBIT is certified by multiple security organizations, including ISO/IEC 27001 for information security management, PCI DSS Level 1 certification for the highest level in the protection of payment data, and the only exchange attaining CCSS Level 3 certification, the highest standard in the industry for cryptocurrency security to date. WhiteBIT acts in accordance with international regulations, thus offering a secure and compliant environment for its users. While building a position among the world top exchanges , yet, WhiteBIT’s listing on Coinglass affirms its commitment to providing traders with transparency and market intelligence for success. The post WhiteBIT Gets Featured on Coinglass Amid Top Exchanges for Data Reliability appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Pundit Says XRP Will Come In and Save the World. Here’s how
body: Crypto commentator X Remi Relief X has posted a detailed message on X, summarizing his eight years of research and insight regarding XRP and the broader financial system. In a post termed as a response to growing concerns over market instability, tariffs, and the performance of assets such as DOGE, Remi claims that recent developments are part of what he calls a “controlled demolition” of the current financial order. According to Remi, XRP is positioned to take on a major role in what he describes as a forthcoming new financial structure. He states directly, “XRP will come in and save the world,” urging his audience to re-read and reflect on the statement. He characterizes this message as a concise version of the extensive analysis he has been undertaking since 2017. MY 8 Years of XRP INFORMATION IN 8 SECONDS Many people are asking me what’s going on with the markets? Why are we crashing? Why the tariffs? Why DOGE? It’s ALL a controlled demolition of the old system. XRP will come in and save the world. Please re-read and understand what… — X Remi Relief X (@RemiReliefX) April 6, 2025 Claims of Delays and Strategic Interference Remi asserts that the transformation was initially planned during President Trump’s first term but was delayed due to the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic and the outcome of the 2020 election. He alleges that “the powers that be were not ready,” implying that the pandemic was released deliberately and that the election outcome was manipulated to slow down the intended implementation of a new financial system involving Ripple and XRP. Remi addresses the 2020 lawsuit the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filed against Ripple in his message. He claims that the action was not simply a regulatory move but a deliberate effort to stall Ripple’s progress while allowing the company to be vetted for future alignment with government-level operations. He asserts that this process has now concluded, stating, “The legacy system has now accepted Ripple/XRP will rule the new financial system,” and links its emergence with future efforts led by President Trump and Elon Musk. Allegations of Musk’s Early XRP Involvement Remi also claims that Elon Musk has been involved with XRP since 2013, holding significant quantities of the asset in various dormant wallets. According to his post, movement in at least one of these wallets occurred in February, which he interprets as a signal of upcoming developments, specifically referencing “X-Payments” as a possible application. He presents this as evidence of behind-the-scenes alignment among influential figures and institutional forces. Patience Urged for Supporters and Early Investors He concludes the message by advising followers to remain patient, expressing confidence that those who invested early in XRP will eventually benefit from the long-term strategy. He finishes by stating that these developments are part of a larger, unstoppable force, writing, “Nobody can stop what God is sending.” The post is positioned as a high-level summary of Remi’s beliefs about XRP’s future, drawing on personal research and undisclosed sources. While it reflects a speculative narrative, it remains consistent with themes he and others have expressed in crypto communities over the years regarding the potential role of XRP in future financial infrastructures. title: Trump’s World Liberty Financial sells $8M in Ethereum amid mounting losses
body: Trump-backed World Liberty Financial appears to be offloading Ethereum following increasing losses as ETH plunges below $1,500. According to data shared on X by Lookonchain, on Apr. 9, a wallet linked to WLFI reportedly sold 5,471 Ethereum ( ETH ) for around $8 million, at a price of $1,465 per coin. The sale represents a major loss. WLFI had previously spent around $210 million to acquire 67,498 ETH at an average price of $3,259. At current prices, the firm is sitting on an unrealized loss of roughly $125 million. Has Trump's World Liberty( @worldlibertyfi ) started selling $ETH at a loss? According to Arkham, a wallet possibly linked to #WorldLiberty sold 5,471 $ETH ($8.01M) at $1,465 30 minutes ago. #WorldLiberty previously spent ~$210M to buy 67,498 $ETH at an average price of $3,259,… pic.twitter.com/jPMqCiADvt — Lookonchain (@lookonchain) April 9, 2025 Despite the losses, the company has been actively expanding its product lineup. On Mar. 25, WLFI confirmed the launch of USD1, a stablecoin backed 1:1 by cash, short-term U.S. Treasuries, and equivalents. The token is currently live on Ethereum and BNB Chain, with more networks to come. You might also like: Ethereum falls below $1.5K for the first time since March 2023 WLFI claims USD1 is built for institutions seeking transparency and compliance, with reserves audited by third parties and custody handled by BitGo. The stablecoin is promoted as a safe substitute for algorithmic or undercollateralized tokens. WLFI was established in 2024 and positions itself as a decentralized finance platform that provides financial tools based on blockchain technology. Through its token sale, the project raised $550 million, including $75 million from Tron founder Justin Sun, who later joined the platform as an advisor. However, the firm has faced governance concerns and criticism over political influence due to its Trump connections. As reported by crypto.news on Apr. 1, The Trump family gained majority control of the platform in January by acquiring a 60% share through a new holding company, WLF Holdco LLC. As a result, they will control 60% of the company’s operating profits after the platform is fully operational, and they are also entitled to 75% of the token sales revenue under the new structure. title: Bitget plans to burn $120 million worth of BGB under new quarterly mechanism
body: Bitget is set to burn more than 30 million BGB for the first quarterly burn of 2025. The crypto exchange has recently updated its burn mechanism according to on-chain usage. According to a press release sent to crypto.news on April 9, the crypto exchange will be using a new burn mechanism for its native token that takes into account more of its on-chain usage. The new mechanism uses a utility-based model to calculate the amount of Bitget Tokens ( BGB ) to burn. The updated burn formula directly links quarterly burn volumes to the amount of BGB paid to on-chain gas fees through the firm’s GetGas accounts. Under the new mechanism for Q1 2025, the platform added approximately 6,943 BGB to its GetGas accounts. Therefore, Bitget is preparing to burn a total of 30 million BGB for this quarter, which is equal to more than $120 million based on current market prices. This means that 30 million BGB will be removed from its total token supply, potentially boosting the remaining token’s value. At press time, BGB has gone down nearly 2.5% in the past 24 hours. It is currently trading hands at $4.07, despite reaching a $4.20 a day prior. The token is still more than 50% below its all-time high of $8.45, which was recorded at the end of December 2024. Price chart for BGB in the past 24 hours of trading, April 9, 2025 | Source: crypto.news You might also like: Bitget becomes the first crypto firm to sponsor a driver on Porsche Cup Brazil 2025 BGB’s circulating supply stands at 1.2 billion BGB with a 24-hour trading volume of $278 million. The token’s trading volume experienced a 13% boost compared to the previous trading day. Meanwhile, the token’s market cap is currently valued at nearly $5 billion. CEO of Bitget, Gracy Chen, stated that a more sustainable burn mechanism was an expected change, considering BGB is in the process of expanding its role within various on-chain ecosystems. “By linking its burn mechanism to actual on-chain utility, BGB’s quarterly burn amount can evolve with real usage. This update incentivizes adoption and enables transparent and sustainable tokenomics,” said Chen in her statement. In January 2025, the crypto exchange burned 800 million BGB held by the internal team, which represented 40% of the total supply. This burn reduced the token’s circulating supply from 2 billion BGB to 1.2 billion BGB. You might also like: Bitget Wallet launches new SuperDEX upgrade after OKX suspends DEX aggregator

title: XRP correction may be ending as bulls watch $2 breakout zone
body: According to analysts, XRP is trading close to a key accumulation zone, which could strengthen its case for an upward rally. In an April 8 X post , Analyst Dom pointed out that XRP is now filling a “liquidity void”, essentially correcting an inefficiency in price action from back in late November. That puts the asset in a tight range between around $1.50 and $2.00. The analyst noted that the $2 mark serves as a critical resistance level and key accumulation zone. A clean break above it would signal a potential structure shift that could officially end the current downtrend. At press time, XRP ( XRP ) was down 3.3% over the past 24 hours, exchanging hands at $1.80, while its market cap was seated at over $104 billion. Its daily trading volume had also dipped 42% to $6.3 billion. Bullish catalysts for XRP Nevertheless, a number of positive XRP-related developments are leading many traders to believe that XRP could be gearing up for a bullish rally. First, the launch of Teucrium’s leveraged XRP ETF (XXRP) marks the first XRP-linked ETF in the U.S., offering double daily returns on XRP. This sets a major precedent for institutional involvement and legitimises Ripple-based investment products in traditional markets. This milestone comes on the heels of the SEC dropping its appeal and settling the Ripple case with a $50 million penalty, effectively removing longstanding regulatory uncertainty around XRP. The legal clarity has sparked renewed institutional interest, with firms like Franklin Templeton, Bitwise, and 21Shares now pursuing spot XRP ETFs. You might also like: Teucrium to launch first leveraged XRP ETF in the U.S. after SEC approval Excitement is also growing around the potential launch of a spot XRP ETF by the end of 2025. According to Polymarket data , approval odds have climbed back to 77%, recovering from a dip to 72% recorded on April 7. Second, Ripple has announced the acquisition of prime brokerage firm Hidden Road in a $1.25 billion deal, one of the largest in the crypto industry’s history. The move expands Ripple’s institutional footprint by leveraging Hidden Road’s established client network, positioning Ripple as a more dominant player in global finance. Third, on-chain metrics support a bullish outlook. Data from Santiment reveals a steady accumulation by wallets holding 100,000 to 100 million XRP, typically considered smart money. This buying activity during the dip suggests strong conviction among larger investors, often seen as a precursor to upward price movement. XRP’s MVRV Z-Score has also dropped to 1.43, its lowest level since November of last year. That’s notable because the last time it was this low, XRP kicked off a bull run and eventually hit its all-time high of $3.40. Source: Santiment A lower MVRV Z-Score usually means the asset is undervalued compared to its historical average, which can be a sign that the market is near a bottom and primed for a rebound. Meanwhile, its weighted funding rate has flipped back to green, indicating improved investor sentiment among XRP derivative traders, as more of them are now placing bullish bets after a period of caution. Source: CoinGlass According to analysts at crypto.news , $2 is the most likely next target for XRP. On a longer time frame, experts at Standard Chartered have set an even higher price target, projecting $5.5 as a realistic target by the year-end. Their forecast comes after XRP’s 580% rally from November 2024 to January 2025, suggesting there’s room for another 214% move from current levels. XRP still in correction phase However, Trader Chetan Gurjar believes XRP is still in its wave 2 correction phase, based on the Elliott Wave theory, a popular trading method where price moves in patterns of five waves up when the market is trending and three waves down when it’s correcting. Right now, Chetan thinks XRP is in one of those “down” phases, wave 2, which usually happens before the next big move up. He sees this dip as a healthy retracement, with possible bottom zones around key Fibonacci levels: $1.48, $1.1453, and $0.8856. Chetan has some lofty long-term targets too: at least $8–$12, with the possibility of XRP reaching as high as $23–$30 during the next major cycle. He does note, though, that a breakdown below $0.3823 would invalidate his current wave count. Read more: XRP price forms doji after bullish Ripple news, gains to be short-lived Disclosure: This article does not represent investment advice. The content and materials featured on this page are for educational purposes only.

title: Kaspersky Flags Crypto-Stealing Malware Hidden in Fake Microsoft Office Add-Ins
body: Cybersecurity firm Kaspersky has flagged a new sophisticated malware that steals crypto using fake Microsoft Office add-ins. These legit-looking extensions are uploaded to SourceForge, a website hosting platform, with descriptions copied from the legitimate GitHub project. Per the malware description posted on Tuesday, appears with the SourceForge domain name and web hosting. “Pages like that are well-indexed by search engines and appear in their search results,” Kaspersky cybersecurity experts wrote. Dubbed “officepackage,” the extension displays a list of office applications complete with version numbers and “Download” buttons. Fake Downloads are Smaller in Size, Raises “Red Flags” Kaspersky noted that the downloads are roughly seven-megabyte in size. “This raises some red flags, as office applications are never that small, even when compressed.” The download pages takes victims to another page with a download button, containing a password-protected archive. However, the zip file after downloading the software exceeds 700 megabytes. Attackers use the pumping technique to inflate the file size to look legit by appending junk data, Kaspersky flagged. “As users seek ways to download applications outside official sources, attackers offer their own,” the report said. “They keep looking for new ways to make their websites look legit.” Cybersecurity firm @Kaspersky has issued a warning about a widespread malware campaign targeting users on @GitHub . #Kaspersky #GitHub https://t.co/TJg8BmgHiV — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) February 26, 2025 Kaspersky Finds ‘ClipBanker’ Malware The firm highlighted that the campaign injects the ClipBanker trojan through SourceForge. “ClipBanker is a malware family that replaces cryptocurrency wallet addresses in the clipboard with the attackers’ own,” it explained. Crypto wallet users usually copy addresses rather than typing them. With the ClipBanker malware, the victim’s money will end up somewhere entirely unexpected. Further, attackers could also sell system access to more dangerous actors apart from stealing cryptos. “We advise users against downloading software from untrusted sources. If you are unable to obtain some software from official sources for any reason, remember that seeking alternative download options always carries higher security risks,” Kaspersky warned. The post Kaspersky Flags Crypto-Stealing Malware Hidden in Fake Microsoft Office Add-Ins appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Cardano (ADA) Price Prediction for April 9
body: The post Cardano (ADA) Price Prediction for April 9 appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News In the ongoing tariff wars, the cryptocurrency market has already experienced notable downside momentum, but it currently appears to be in recovery. Amid this, the Cardano (ADA) price prediction has become a key topic of discussion, whether the current price rebound is genuine or merely a normal price correction before further downward movement. Following this notable price decline, the asset has lost its hold on a key support level at $0.64. This level has a strong history of triggering price reversals and rebounds. Source: Trading View According to Coinpedia’s technical analysis, ADA is poised to continue its downward momentum as it has successfully closed a daily candle below the key support level. Additionally, the asset has also retested that breakdown level. On the smaller time frame (Four-Hour Chart), ADA appears to be moving in an uptrend, taking support from an ascending trendline. Cardano (ADA) Price Prediction Based on recent price action and historical momentum, if ADA falls further and closes a four-hour candle below the trendline support, there is a strong possibility it could decline by 20% to reach the $0.43 level in the coming days. Source: Trading Volume At present, ADA is trading below the 200 Exponential Moving Average (EMA) on both the four-hour and daily time frames. This indicates that the asset is in strong bearish momentum and is showing weak price action. However, in such conditions, investors and traders often look for an upside rally as a shorting opportunity. Current Price Momentum ADA is currently trading near $0.575 and has recorded a price decline of over 2% in the past 24 hours. Meanwhile, during the same period, its trading volume dropped by 15%, indicating lower participation from traders and investors compared to the previous day. $16.40 Million Worth of Bearish Bet Looking at the current price momentum and ADA’s bearish outlook, traders seem to be strongly betting on the bearish side, as reported by the on-chain analytics firm Coinglass. Source: Coinglass Data further reveals that traders are currently over-leveraged at $0.544 on the lower side (support) and $0.588 on the upper side (resistance). At these levels, traders have built $8.33 million and $16.40 million worth of long and short positions, respectively. These positions by traders reflect how they currently view ADA, which appears to be bearish. Moreover, with $16.40 million worth of short positions, there is a strong possibility that this could put downward pressure on ADA in the coming days.

title: Strategy may be forced to sell bitcoin, breaking ‘hodl’ pledge
body: Strategy revealed in a recent 8-K filing with the SEC that it may be forced to sell its Bitcoin to meet debt obligations if BTC prices continue to drop. The move could potentially break Micheal Saylor’s long-standing “never sell Bitcoin” stance. The company stated that it could be required to liquidate its digital assets at a loss or under unfavorable terms if it lacks access to favorable equity or debt financing. Strategy currently holds 528,185 Bitcoins at an average cost of $67,458 per BTC, valued at $40.119 billion. Strategy warns to liquidate its BTC amid escalated U.S.-China trade war $MSTR : FFS add @Forbes to the list as well. This language is in every 8-K people, every one of them. This isn't new | shocking: https://t.co/ukhDxjyKuk — Adrian Morris (@Adrian_R_Morris) April 8, 2025 Bitcoin has been wildly volatile over the last week as traders and digital asset investors scrambled to get ahead of a “crisis scenario” for BTC. Micheal Saylor’s software company-turned-bitcoin buyer Strategy has warned it could be forced to sell some of its Bitcoin to meet its financial obligations. The firm noted in a recent 8-K filing with the SEC that without access to favorable equity or debt financing, it could be required to liquidate BTC at a loss or under unfavorable terms. The company has acquired 275,965 BTC at an average price of $93,228 since Trump’s November 2024 election win. The firm also currently holds nearly 530,000 BTC at an average cost of $67,000 per Bitcoin, valued at roughly $42 billion. Strategy has fueled its digital asset purchases by selling convertible bonds and issuing stock. “As Bitcoin constitutes the vast bulk of assets on our balance sheet, if we are unable to secure equity or debt financing in a timely manner … we may be required to sell Bitcoin to satisfy our financial obligations, and we may be required to make such sales at prices below our cost basis or that are otherwise unfavorable.” ~ Strategy. The software company acknowledged that it’s expecting to record a near -$6 billion unrealized loss for the first quarter, despite a related $1.69 billion income tax benefit. Strategy also warned it might not be able to regain profitability in future quarters, especially if the value of its BTC continues to drop. The largest BTC Treasury company held around $8 billion worth of debt at the end of March. It also owes about $35 million per year in interest in addition to around $150 million it must pay every year in dividends on its stock. The filing highlighted that “a significant decrease in the market value of our Bitcoin holdings could adversely affect our ability to satisfy our financial obligations.” The firm’s share price has almost halved since soaring to its November peak that saw it inducted into the Nasdaq 100 index. Bloomberg Intelligence senior commodity strategist Mike McGlone argued that “Everyone’s in for the long-term, as long as it’s going up.” He also mentioned that he didn’t know how BTC was going to get to $100,000 from $10,000 in 2020, but the trends showed up. Now, he sees the reversion path “back towards $10,000.” Trump’s trade war causes Bitcoin to fall Bitcoin plummeted sharply in the wake of Donald Trump’s sweeping reciprocal tariffs, which were announced on Wednesday and branded as “Liberation Day.” He imposed a 10% baseline tariff on all imports to the U.S. but added higher rates on other nations based on how they tax U.S. goods. The U.S. President argued that the move was a way to erase America’s trade deficit and protect U.S. manufacturers. Moody’s Analytics chief economist Mark Zandi has warned that extended tariffs could push both the U.S. and its trading partners into recessions. The crypto market breathed a sigh of relief after Trump announced the 10% across-the-board tariff since many expected harsher measures. The initial reaction caused BTC to drop to around $88,000. After he announced additional tariffs and higher rates on major trade partners, concerns over inflation and economic uncertainty sent Bitcoin tumbling down to $81,000. The virtual currency has also plummeted to lows not seen since early November and is currently exchanging hands at $76,908 at the time of publication, a 3.55% drop in the last 24 hours.
